title: 112_hr6535
content:
The "Save America's National Economy Act" repeals Section 251A of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 and increases tax rates for taxpayers with over $1,000,000 in taxable income. Tax rates increase for taxpayers with taxable income over $1,000,000 as follows: 15% for income not over $69,000, $10,350 plus 28% for income over $69,000 but not over $139,350, $30,048 plus 31% for income over $139,350 but not over $212,300, $52,662.50 plus 36% for income over $212,300 but not over $379,150, and $112,728.50 plus 39.6% for income over $379,150 but not over $1,000,000. For taxable income over $1,000,000, the tax rates are as follows:
- $358,585.10 plus 45% of the excess over $1,000,000 for income up to $10,000,000
- $4,408,585.10 plus 46% of the excess over $10,000,000 for income up to $20,000,000
- $9,008,585.10 plus 47% of the excess over $20,000,000 for income up to $100,000,000
- $46,608,585.10 plus 48% of the excess over $100,000,000 for income up to $1,000,000,000
- For income over $1,000,000,000, the tax rates continue to increase. The tax rates for taxable income over $1,000,000 are as follows: $478,608,585.10 plus 49% of the excess over $1,000,000,000 for heads of household. For taxable income over $46,250, the tax rates are as follows:
- Not over $46,250: 15% of taxable income
- Over $46,250 but not over $119,400: $6,937.50 plus 28% of the excess
- Over $119,400 but not over $193,350: $27,419.50 plus 31% of the excess
- Over $193,350 but not over $379,150: $50,344 plus 36% of the excess
- Over $379,150 but not over $1,000,000: $117,232 plus 39.6% of the excess For taxable income over $1,000,000, the tax rates are as follows:
- Over $1,000,000 but not over $10,000,000: $363,088.60 plus 45% of the excess
- Over $10,000,000 but not over $20,000,000: $4,413,088.60 plus 46% of the excess
- Over $20,000,000 but not over $100,000,000: $9,013,088.60 plus 47% of the excess
- Over $100,000,000 but not over $1,000,000,000: $46,613,088.60 plus 48% of the excess
- Over $1,000,000,000: Continued... The tax rates for taxable income over $1,000,000 are as follows: $478,613,088.60 plus 49% of the excess over $1,000,000,000 for unmarried individuals. Tax rates for taxable income range from 15% for income not over $34,500 to 39.6% for income over $379,150 but not over $1,000,000. For taxable income over $1,000,000, the tax rate is $366,637.60 plus 45% of the excess. This increases for higher income brackets, with rates of $4,416,637.60 plus 46% for income over $10,000,000, $9,016,637.60 plus 47% for income over $20,000,000, and $46,616,637.60 plus 48% for income over $100,000,000. For taxable income over $1,000,000, the tax rate is $478,616,637.60 plus 49% of the excess. Married individuals filing separate returns have a revised tax table in subsection (d) of section 1 of the Code. Taxable income determines the tax rate as follows:
- Not over $34,500: 15% of taxable income
- Over $34,500 but not over $69,675: $5,175 plus 28% of the excess
- Over $69,675 but not over $106,150: $15,024 plus 31% of the excess
- Over $106,150 but not over $189,575: $26,331.25 plus 35% of the excess
- Over $189,575 but not over $500,000: $55,530 plus 39.6% of the excess
- Over $500,000 but not over $5,000,000: (tax rate not provided) For taxable income over $500,000 but not over $5,000,000, the tax rate is $178,458.30 plus 45% of the excess. For income over $5,000,000 but not over $10,000,000, the rate is $2,203,458.30 plus 46% of the excess. For income over $10,000,000 but not over $50,000,000, the rate is $4,503,458.30 plus 47% of the excess. For income over $50,000,000 but not over $500,000,000, the rate is $23,303,458.30 plus 48% of the excess. For income over $500,000,000, the rate is $239,303,458.30 plus 49% of the excess. The tax rate for income over $500,000,000 is $239,303,458.30 plus 49% of the excess. There is a special rule for capital gains in case of taxable income subject to at least a 45-percent rate bracket. The amendments made by this section will reduce the amount of net capital gain for taxpayers in taxable years beginning after December 31, 2013. SEC. 4. SAVINGS FROM OVERSEAS CONTINGENCY AND RELATED ACTIVITIES. The Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to include a cap adjustment for overseas contingency and related activities in appropriations bills. The Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to include cap adjustments for overseas contingency and related activities in appropriations bills. For fiscal years 2013, 2014, 2015, and 2016, specific budget authority levels are set at $83 billion, $50 billion, $50 billion, and unspecified, respectively. For fiscal years 2016 to 2021, $50,000,000,000 in budget authority is allocated annually. Section 251(a)(2) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to address breaches. The Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to address breaches by reducing non-exempt account budgets to eliminate breaches within specific categories. Any excess budget authority for overseas contingency operations is included in breach determinations on a proportional basis. The Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to address breaches by reducing non-exempt account budgets within specific categories. Excess budget authority for overseas contingency operations is included in breach determinations on a proportional basis. Amendments are made to Section 251(b)(2)(A) regarding emergency appropriations.
